night1and2.title: Traverse City State Park
night1and2.content: Immerse yourself in nature by camping at Traverse City State Park, situated right on Traverse City Bay. Enjoy the serenity of the outdoors while being just 10 minutes away from downtown.

night1and2.title: Timber Ridge Recreation
night1and2.content: Nestled near Lake Michigan at the base of the east arm of Grand Traverse Bay, Timber Ridge RV & Recreation Resort boasts a charming location bordering Pere Marquette State Forest. With eight basic cabins, 10 deluxe cabins, and 15 full-service cottages, it's an ideal year-round haven for weekend getaways, family reunions, or retirement parties. In summer, revel in the swimming pool, nature trails, playground, family activities, and more. Winter brings heated cabins, cross-country ski rentals, access to a lodge and kitchen, and direct entry to groomed snowmobile trails. Just 10 minutes from downtown Traverse City, this peaceful retreat offers over 200 clean campsites, resort-quality facilities, and additional perks like barbecue grills, a camp store, and laundry facilities.

night1and2.title: Anchor Inn
night1and2.content: Immerse yourself in nature by camping at Traverse City State Park, situated right on Traverse City Bay. Enjoy the serenity of the outdoors while being just 10 minutes away from downtown.

night1and2.title: Traverse City KOA
night1and2.content: Traverse City KOA stands out as a top-tier camping destination in Northern Michigan, boasting a prime location that combines natural beauty with urban convenience. Campers can choose from RV sites, tent sites, or comfortable cabins, all surrounded by the picturesque landscapes of the region. Located just a short drive from downtown Traverse City, this family-friendly campground offers easy access to the city's attractions while providing a serene retreat. The well-equipped facilities include clean restrooms, a camp store stocked with essentials, and a refreshing swimming pool. Guests can immerse themselves in a range of recreational activities, from exploring nearby hiking trails to enjoying themed weekends and organized events. Traverse City KOA ensures a distinctive camping experience, blending relaxation with outdoor adventures for an unforgettable stay in the heart of Michigan.

night3and4.title: Mackinaw Mill Creek Camping & Cabins
night3and4.content: Uncover the enchantment of Mackinaw Mill Creek Camping and Glamping, strategically positioned just a brief 5-minute drive from the ferry port to Mackinaw Island. This accommodation offers the choice between tents or cabins and is conveniently situated right next to the water. It serves as the perfect base camp for your island exploration adventures.

night3and4.title: Straits State Park
night3and4.content: Straits State Park has fantastic views of the Mackinac Bridge and the boat traffic going under the bridge on the Straits of Mackinac from the trails, campground or the viewing platform. The park has a picnic area, playground and waterfront area along Lake Huron.

night3and4.title: Cabins of Mackinaw
night3and4.content: Nestled in Downtown Mackinaw City, Cabins of Mackinac offer a two-story retreat with two bedrooms, a jacuzzi bath, kitchenette, and living area. Located across from Mackinac Island Ferry Docks, guests enjoy a scenic view of Lake Huron. Amenities include indoor/outdoor pools, a whirlpool spa, and unlimited access to the adjacent Pirate's Adventure waterpark. Perfect for a relaxing Mackinaw getaway with convenient access to both tranquility and adventure.

night3and4.title: St Ignace / Mackinac Island KOA
night3and4.content: Mackinaw City KOA is an ideal retreat for those seeking a cozy stay in a tent or cabin, conveniently located just 6 minutes from the Mackinac Island port. While it's not directly situated on the beach, the campground offers a short and pleasant walk to the shore. Embrace the scenic surroundings as you enjoy the close proximity to the water, providing a serene and picturesque setting. Whether you prefer the charm of a tent or the comfort of a cabin, Mackinaw City KOA ensures a delightful stay with its strategic location and easy access to both natural beauty and the gateway to Mackinac Island.

night5.title: Uncle Ducky's - Paddlers Village
night5.content: Uncle Ducky's - Paddlers Village offers a charming accommodation near Pictured Rocks, allowing guests to choose between yurts, tents, and cabins. With a delightful beer garden and lakefront access, it provides a serene and versatile retreat for a memorable stay.
